pages.text: This block reads lines from the instruction book upon receieving a redstone signal from the red input on the right side. It then powers the wired cable in the sequence specified by the instructions. Once the programmer reaches the end of the instructions, it will stop.

Once it stops, the programmer will power the green wire on the left side of the block. Keep in mind that if you reapply a signal to the red input, the sequence will start at the beginning again. The programmer's instructions consist of 16 digits or letters from A to V. One row equals one set.
